sentence: I assign points to both "The municipality takes the lead and unburdens" and to "Residents do it themselves". This seems contradictory, and it is. Nevertheless, I also think the residents' own initiative is important. For support, for social cohesion, but also for management. A local cooperative will be able to supply energy significantly cheaper than a commercial party. I have a hesitation about sustainability. People move, neighborhoods change, engagement can become less. To what extent can a cooperative guarantee that everyone always has access to energy?

argument.Annotator_1: ( I also think the residents' own initiative is important)
argument.Annotator_2: (The residents' own initiative is important)
argument.Annotator_3: (the residents' own initiative is important) AND (People move, neighborhoods change, engagement can become less.)
argument.Annotator_4: (the residents' own initiative is important. For support, for social cohesion, but also for management) AND (A local cooperative will be able to supply energy significantly cheaper than a commercial party)
argument.Annotator_5: (A local cooperative will be able to supply energy significantly cheaper than a commercial party)

sentence: I would like to see a large field of solar panels, worn by the inhabitants themselves, paid for by the inhabitants themselves, the moment a resident leaves for the area he should be able to sell his part back, new residents should also be able to buy a part. In this way, you as a municipality become self-sufficient while it is affordable for the vast majority of residents. Residents who would not be able to participate financially, must be able to use the solar energy, as they currently purchase electricity from their supplier.

sentence: Here I have given 10 points. A fairly large wind farm is already coming near me, between Zurich and Witmarsum.  I think that's enough for Súdwest-Fryslân.  The idea of making Súdwest-Fryslân the supplier of the Netherlands seems to me to be a bad idea.  We have wind here, so let's limit ourselves to windmills. Then other parts of the country can invest in large-scale solar parks with less wind. Please share the burden.

sentence: We have the space in the countryside to generate more than we consume. We owe our entire polder country to wind energy. The wind is nice here. Let's do more than our part here. They are opportunities. A new landscape is not necessarily a bad landscape. But let the profits descend locally. People have been given a little more to spend, e.g. for sustainable products, which are now slightly more expensive. Living and building land is far too expensive in Ned. Too much money is being knocked out of people's pockets for housing. Because of these high costs, the willingness to invest in sustainability is lower than in the surrounding countries.

argument.Annotator_1: (We have space in the countryside to generate more than we consume) AND (We owe our entire polder country to wind energy) AND (The wind is nice here) AND (Too much money is being knocked out of people's pockets for housing) AND (the high costs)

argument.Annotator_3: (We have the space in the countryside to generate more than we consume) AND (We owe our entire polder country to wind energy) AND (The wind is nice here) AND (these high costs)
argument.Annotator_4: (We have the space in the countryside to generate more than we consume) AND (We owe our entire polder country to wind energy) AND (The wind is nice here) AND (They are opportunities) AND (A new landscape is not necessarily a bad landscape) AND (People have been given a little more to spend) AND (Living and building land is far too expensive in Ned) AND (Too much money is being knocked out of people's pockets for housing) AND (Because of these high costs)
